page.title: 16TRADE
page.content: There are three shops in Roos and one at Sand le Mere camp,Tunstall.The SPAR shop is the largest and also acts as the post office.They provide all postal services and sell general grocery products.Fresh milk and bread arrives daily but their most popular sales are crisps and pet food.The present shop was originally the sadlers.Hinch's shop was a doctor's surgery, the shop being the waiting room.Mr.Hinch sells sweets,papers, groceries and petrol.He has owned the shop for 40 years.The butchers was originally built as a drapers shop.The first butcher was William Henry Johnson about 100 years ago.There were two others owners:Mr.F.Whiting and Mr.A.Foster before the present owner Mr.D.Bradley took over.He sells all meats but nolonger slaughters his own animals.
